dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Warren Buffett Sold This Stock, but I Think He's Completely Wrong
News Content: Heading into 2023, Warren Buffett-led Berkshire Hathaway's (NYSE: BRK.A)(NYSE: BRK.B) had a substantial investment in General Motors(NYSE: GM). According to Berkshire's SEC filings, the conglomerate owned 50 million shares of GM at the beginning of that year, worth about $1.7 billion at the time.

Throughout 2023, Buffett unloaded all of Berkshire's General Motors stock. However, I think he made the wrong decision. Not only is General Motors up by more than 55% since the end of the quarter when Berkshire sold, but the company is also doing a great job of maximizing profits and creating shareholder value.

Lots to like about this "legacy" automaker

Even though Buffett sold GM, there's quite a bit to like about the stock right now.

For one thing, the business has been surprisingly resilient, given the combination of higher interest rates and more cautious consumer spending. In the company's third-quarter 2024 earnings, the latest reported, GM surprised investors with both top- and bottom-line results that handily surpassed expectations, as well as an increase in its full-year earnings guidance.

Then, at its October 2024 investor day, management surprised the market, which expected a slowdown, by saying that its 2025 adjusted earnings will be in a "similar range" to 2024.

Other recent news has been quite encouraging as well. GM reported that its 2024 sales increased by 4% and that its market share increased overall and doubled in the case of electric vehicles. Deliveries in China increased by 40.6% sequentially in the fourth quarter.

Another recent development is that GM will pivot its Cruise autonomous strategy away from developing robotaxis and toward developing its Super Cruise autonomous technology for personal vehicles. This move alone is expected to save the company more than $1 billion annually.

GM is also aggressively using excess capital to buy back shares. Since late 2023, when GM announced an accelerated buyback program, the company's outstanding share count has declined by 21%, and there could be more buybacks ahead, especially considering the stronger-than-expected 2025 outlook and the fact that it hopefully won't be sinking as much money into automation. It's also worth noting that since the buyback was announced, GM's stock is up by more than 40%.

It's not too surprising that GM is being so aggressive with buybacks. The stock trades for just 5.5 times trailing-12-month earnings and 5.1 times forward earnings. If GM can achieve its 2025 targets and execute well on its growth plans, the stock could be a tremendous bargain.

Story Continues

Why did Buffett sell?

Buffett hasn't specified his reasons for selling General Motors. But it's worth noting that he has been a net seller of stocks for the past couple of years and has aggressively reduced some of Berkshire's largest investments, including the massive stakes in Apple(NASDAQ: AAPL) and Bank of America(NYSE: BAC).

My instinct is that he sold because of some of the perceived risk factors with the stock. At the time of the sales, many experts were forecasting new auto demand to fall more than it actually did, and in the fall of 2023, there was a strike by auto workers that cost GM an estimated $800 million.

Whatever the reasons Buffett had for selling might be, I think he's wrong, and I don't often say that about Buffett's moves. GM is doing a fantastic job of keeping its sales and profit high, and I think this could be one of the biggest bargains in the stock market right now.

Should you invest $1,000 in General Motors right now?

Before you buy stock in General Motors, consider this:

The Motley Fool Stock Advisor analyst team just identified what they believe are the 10 best stocks for investors to buy now… and General Motors wasn’t one of them. The 10 stocks that made the cut could produce monster returns in the coming years.

Consider when Nvidia made this list on April 15, 2005... if you invested $1,000 at the time of our recommendation, you’d have $843,960!*

Stock Advisor provides investors with an easy-to-follow blueprint for success, including guidance on building a portfolio, regular updates from analysts, and two new stock picks each month. TheStock Advisorservice has more than quadrupled the return of S&P 500 since 2002*.

See the 10 stocks »

*Stock Advisor returns as of January 13, 2025

Bank of America is an advertising partner of Motley Fool Money. Matt Frankel has positions in Bank of America, Berkshire Hathaway, and General Motors. The Motley Fool has positions in and recommends Apple, Bank of America, and Berkshire Hathaway. The Motley Fool recommends General Motors and recommends the following options: long January 2025 $25 calls on General Motors. The Motley Fool has a disclosure policy.

Warren Buffett Sold This Stock, but I Think He's Completely Wrong was originally published by The Motley Fool

View Comments

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.2, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.8, Reasoning: The news indicates a bearish sentiment from Wall Street towards Apple due to downgrades from firms like Loop Capital and Jefferies. The main concerns revolve around slowed growth in China and increased local competition in a crucial market. Analyst Ben Bajarin’s comments suggest that growth prospects in China are uncertain, and he emphasizes the need for a new hardware cycle to stimulate interest in Apple's products. These factors strongly point to negative sentiment in the market, which would likely lead to a higher probability of the stock price falling rather than rising.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The article presents a cautiously negative outlook for Apple's upcoming Q1 2025 earnings report. It highlights concerns about stagnant revenue growth, the diminishing effectiveness of share buybacks, and increasing competition. Analysts' expectations are already low, so even meeting those expectations might not be enough to move the stock price significantly higher. The high valuation (32x forward earnings) suggests limited upside potential. The author explicitly advises against buying Apple stock before the earnings report. While a positive surprise is possible, the overall tone and analysis point towards a higher likelihood of a negative or neutral reaction to the report.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.1, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.2, Reasoning: The news focuses on Meta's expansion into wearable technology, directly competing with Apple's existing product lines (smartwatches and AirPods).  While Meta's advancements in AR/VR are noteworthy, the impact on Apple's stock price is likely to be indirect and relatively small. Meta's success in the wearable market wouldn't necessarily translate to significant losses for Apple, especially given Apple's established brand loyalty and existing market dominance. The news is more relevant to Meta's stock than Apple's.  The probability of a price change for Apple is therefore considered low, leaning slightly towards no change. The potential for a small negative impact due to increased competition is considered slightly more probable than a positive impact.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The provided news headline is a generic question about whether to buy Apple stock before a specific date (Jan. 30), but it lacks any substantive information or context (e.g., earnings reports, product launches, or macroeconomic factors). Without additional details, it is impossible to determine a clear bullish or bearish signal. Apple's stock price movement around such dates often depends on broader market trends, investor sentiment, or undisclosed events. Given the lack of actionable information, the probabilities are assigned neutrally.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news article mentions that Apple Inc. (AAPL) has an implied upside of 41% in 2025, according to Wedbush analyst Dan Ives, who lifted his price target on Apple to $325 per share. The analyst's optimism is based on Apple's integration of artificial intelligence (AI) solutions into its products, the company's continued transformation as a services provider, and its world-leading capital-return program. However, the article also notes that Apple stock is historically pricey relative to its trailing-12-month EPS, and Berkshire Hathaway's recent sale of 67% of its stake in Apple. Considering these factors, there is a positive outlook for Apple's stock price, but with some caution due to its current valuation.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news headline 'Is Apple Stock Still a Market Leader?' is neutral and does not provide any concrete positive or negative information about the company's current performance or future prospects. Therefore, it is unlikely to have a significant impact on the stock price. However, given that Apple is a well-established and successful company, any neutral news may slightly lean towards a positive sentiment, assuming investors maintain confidence in the company's market leadership and future growth potential.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: -1, Prediction of stock price falling: -1, Reasoning: Fail to give a prediction. Error Reason: Parse error


Now give your prediction about the probability of the stock price of the relevant company rising or falling. Format your response in JSON format and include the following information as follows: 
{ 
"reasoning": "[Summarize your analysis and reasoning process here]", 
"company_name": "[Company Name indicating the name of the company]", 
"company_symbol": "[Company Symbol indicating the stock symbol of the company]", 
"news_headline": "[News Headline indicating the provided financial news headline]", 
"probability_of_stock_price_rise": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will rise due to this news], 
"probability_of_stock_price_fall": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will fall due to this news], 
} 
Do not generate output that isn't in properly formatted JSON.

```json
{
"reasoning": "The financial news primarily discusses Warren Buffett's decision to sell General Motors (GM) stock and the author's belief that this decision was incorrect. The news does not mention Apple Inc. (AAPL) directly, and as such, there's limited direct information impacting Apple's stock price. The analysis of GM stock suggests robust growth, strong earnings, and buybacks which imply a generally positive sentiment towards the automotive sector. However, without any explicit connection to Apple, the news does not provide a clear bullish or bearish signal for AAPL. Hence, the probability of stock price change remains relatively neutral.",
"company_name": "Apple Inc.",
"company_symbol": "AAPL",
"news_headline": "Warren Buffett Sold This Stock, but I Think He's Completely Wrong",
"probability_of_stock_price_rise": 0.3,
"probability_of_stock_price_fall": 0.7
}
```
